chapter.title: Distributions
chapter.intro_public_html: A 250-400 word introductory paragraph for the chapter hub page.

seo_meta.title_tag: Distributions: A Guide to Retirement Account Withdrawals
seo_meta.meta_description: Learn about the different types of retirement account distributions and strategies for taking money out in retirement.

sections.title: DC Plan Distributions
sections.preview_public_html: A 150-250 word summary for the chapter hub page, teasing the content of this section.
sections.section_public_html:
DC Plan Distributions

This is the main public content for the H2 page. It should be a 600-1,000 word overview.

sub_objectives.title: Option 1: Leave the money in the plan (if permitted).
sub_objectives.teaser_public: Leaving money in an old employer plan may maintain creditor protection but limits investment options.
sub_objectives.body_private_html: This is the full, detailed, and gated content for the H3, which feeds the RAG system.

sub_objectives.title: Option 2: Transfer the money to a new employer plan.
sub_objectives.teaser_public: Transferring funds to a new plan allows for continued contributions and maintains creditor protection.

chunks.text_plain: If working, the employee can continue to make contributions...

sections.title: Net Unrealized Appreciation
sections.preview_public_html: A summary for the chapter hub page describing the NUA tax strategy for company stock.
sections.section_public_html:
Net Unrealized Appreciation (NUA)

This is the public overview (900-1,200 words) for the elevated H3 page, explaining how NUA works in detail.

sub_objectives.title: What are the details?
sub_objectives.teaser_public: A brief sentence explaining the core requirements and benefits of NUA.
sub_objectives.body_private_html: The rule applies to individuals who own shares of a company they work for AND the shares are in a 401(k) or similar qualified account.

chunks.text_plain: This applies to individuals who own shares of a company they work for...
